tournament.name: Fuguete Champ 266 - Play Point P/ Top 10

decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to swarm the battlefield with low-cost creatures and bolster them with a variety of enchantments and auras. By utilizing a combination of creature abilities and spell effects, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a large number of powerful creatures that are difficult to deal with in combat. The inclusion of protection and evasion spells also ensures that the creatures are able to stay on the battlefield longer and continue to apply pressure to the opponent.

Utilizing a combination of powerful faerie creatures and efficient control spells, this Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies while maintaining card advantage. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game by countering key spells, removing threats, and drawing cards with card selection spells. With a mix of aggression and disruption, this deck aims to outlast opponents and secure victories through careful planning and resource management.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using cheap spells and creatures to stall the opponent while generating value with cards like Mulldrifter and Archaeomancer. The deck focuses on recurring powerful spells like Ephemerate and Ghostly Flicker to gain card advantage and control the board. By utilizing bounce effects like Snap and Ride's End, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and ultimately outvalue them with card draw and control elements.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures and utilizing tempo plays to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By efficiently countering spells and bouncing creatures back to hand, it aims to maintain control of the game and chip away at the opponent's life total. The inclusion of card draw spells ensures that the deck can consistently find the resources it needs to outpace its opponent. Overall, the deck aims to win through small, incremental advantages and overwhelming the opponent with its aggressive creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Arbor Elf, Utopia Sprawl, and Wild Growth to cast powerful creatures like Eldrazi Repurposer, Avenging Hunter, and Boarding Party. Writhing Chrysalis can create additional threats, while Mwonvuli Acid-Moss and Thermokarst disrupt the opponent's mana base. Lightning Bolt and Malevolent Rumble provide removal and reach. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and overwhelm them with creatures and removal, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize and come back in the game.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on sacrificing creatures for additional value and card draw while aiming to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The key concept revolves around building a wide board presence and utilizing sacrifice triggers to boost the power of Mortician Beetle and Bloodthrone Vampire, while also leveraging card advantage through cards like Village Rites. The deck combines aggressive creatures with sacrifice outlets and recursion spells to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on quickly playing cheap creatures and countering opponent's spells. Using cards like Delver of Secrets, Tolarian Terror, and Cryptic Serpent to apply pressure, while also utilizing efficient card draw and disruption spells like Brainstorm, Counterspell, and Force Spike to stay ahead. Boomerang and Echoing Truth provide additional forms of disruption, while Piracy Charm and Artful Dodge offer ways to push through damage. The objective is to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive tempo strategy, using the Island mana base to support the low casting cost of the spells.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to deal damage as fast as possible and win the game before the opponent can stabilize. By combining low-cost creatures like Goblin Bushwhacker and Goblin Tomb Raider with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast, along with pump effects from Wrenn's Resolve and Rally at the Hornburg, the deck aims to maintain a steady stream of pressure and close out the game before the opponent can mount a strong defense.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creatures using cards like Balustrade Spy and Generous Ent, then using Dread Return to reanimate a powerful creature like Lotleth Giant. The deck also utilizes mana dorks like Overgrown Battlement and Axebane Guardian to ramp up quickly and cast big spells like Lead the Stampede. The key strategy is to quickly combo off, filling the field with creatures and overwhelming the opponent with a powerful board presence.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and creature manipulation, while also generating card advantage with cards like Augur of Bolas and Spellstutter Sprite. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan, maintaining board presence with faeries, and eventually winning through attrition. Key cards like Counterspell, Snuff Out, and LÃ³rien Revealed help to control the battlefield, while creatures like Ninja of the Deep Hours and Thorn of the Black Rose provide additional card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a victory.

The key concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy using a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and bounce effects while generating card advantage through card draw and token generation. The deck aims to control the game tempo and outvalue the opponent with efficient spells and creatures. The inclusion of artifacts like Cryogen Relic and Mistvault Bridge provides additional flexibility and synergy with the deck's strategy. Overall, the deck focuses on resource management and maintaining control of the board to secure victory in a Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a board of powerful Elf creatures to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of attackers. By utilizing mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Priest of Titania, the deck can quickly ramp into powerful threats like Timberwatch Elf and Nyxborn Hydra. Wellwisher provides valuable lifegain to outlast aggro opponents, while Vines of Vastwood protects key creatures. Lead the Stampede and Winding Way ensure a steady stream of Elves to keep the pressure on. The goal is to build a wide board and buff them with Timberwatch Elf to secure victory.

The deck focuses on using Ephemerate to protect key creatures and generate card advantage through flickering effects like Ghostly Flicker and Meeting of Minds. God-Pharaoh's Faithful and Sunscape Familiar provide early defense, while Archaeomancer and Mulldrifter provide late game value. The deck runs a low curve with lots of card draw and interaction, aiming to outvalue opponents and control the flow of the game. It relies on a solid mana base with bounce lands like Azorius Chancery for mana efficiency and consistency.

The deck focuses on playing inexpensive creatures to deal damage quickly, while using burn spells to finish off opponents. By including cards that deal damage directly to opponents, as well as cards that provide additional benefits when casting spells, the deck can put pressure on opponents early and maintain a strong board presence. The strategy is to overwhelm opponents with efficient threats and burn spells, while also using card draw to ensure a consistent stream of threats and answers.

The Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures with efficient abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also utilizes bounce lands and artifact lands to quickly cast spells and keep up the pressure. The deck includes cards that provide card advantage, life gain, and removal to maintain its tempo and out-value the opponent. The Orzhov Aggro deck aims to establish board control early and finish the game with a combination of combat damage and removal spells, while generating value through the use of its creatures and spells.

The main idea of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures and efficient burn spells. By combining creatures like Voldaren Epicure and Sneaky Snacker with direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper, the deck aims to take control of the game early on. Cards like Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize help to maintain card advantage and find the necessary cards to push through the final points of damage. Highway Robbery provides additional reach, while Alms of the Vein and Vampire's Kiss help to stabilize against aggressive opponents. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan while also ensuring consistent access to both red and black mana sources.
